statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Kerry Kittles scored 16 of his 18 points in the third quarter and the New Jersey welcomed Kenyon Martin back from his second suspension by beating the Los Angeles Clippers 108-89 on Thursday night.
article.headline: Martin keeps his cool in Nets' victory

images.name: Kittles, Kerry 020110 inline
images.caption: Kerry Kittles drives underneath the Clippers' Lamar Odom.

article.linkText: Martin keeps his cool as Nets ice Clippers
article.story:
EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J. (AP) -- Kenyon Martin's return from his second suspension was overshadowed by another comeback, the one Kerry Kittles has been putting on all season. Kittles scored 16 of his 18 points in the third quarter and the Nets made Martin's return from a two-game suspension relatively unexciting by beating the Los Angeles Clippers 108-89 Thursday night. "He seemed to be getting better and better," Nets coach Byron Scott said of Kittles, who missed all last season following his fourth surgery on his right knee. "He's in a real good rhythm right now," Scott added. "He is shooting the heck out of the ball." Kittles was seven of 12 from the field, hitting all three of his 3-point attempts. In his last six games, he has averaged 15.33 points while shooting 58.2 percent from the field. "It feels good," Kittles said. "Nothing like having a rhythm going. The shot feels good when you release it. You know it's going in." That took all the pressure off Martin, who now has missed three games in the last two weeks because of flagrant fouls against Karl Malone of Utah and Tracy McGrady of Orlando. He finished with 12 points. More importantly, the top pick in last year's draft kept his cool. "I was trying to play basketball and not be too excited," said Martin, whose big highlight was a dunk in the fourth quarter. "I was trying to pace myself so I didn't get too tired too quick." The Nets face the Magic on Saturday night in Orlando, so Martin will again go against McGrady. As he has done all season, Jason Kidd spread the ball around, handing out 11 assists to go along with his seven points and nine rebounds. He played only 28 minutes, returning briefly in the fourth quarter after the Clippers cut a 21-point lead to 14. Los Angeles never got closer as the Nets won their third straight and seventh in nine games. Todd MacCulloch added 17 points, Richard Jefferson 13, and Aaron Williams and rookie Jason Collins each had 12. Collins also had a team-high 11 rebounds. Lamar Odom had 14 points and Elton Brand had 13 points and 11 rebounds to lead the Clippers, who lost their third straight to start a six-game road trip that still includes stops in Charlotte, Toronto and Minnesota. Los Angeles is 2-11 on the road this season. Michael Olowokandi had 12 points and 10 rebounds, and Jeff McInnis finished with 11 in a game Los Angeles coach Alvin Gentry benched most of his starters for a good part of the final 15 minutes. Kittles and the Nets blew the game open with a 20-7 third-quarter spurt during which Kittles scored the first 12 points, hitting two 3-pointers, two layups and a jumper. Kidd had four assists in that run and he added two more when MacCulloch broke Kittles' run with a layup. The next trip up court, Kidd found Kittles for another 3-pointer. Olowokandi was baffled by the Clippers' defensive play in that series. "He hit one, then two," Olowokandi said. "After the second one, I think there should have been a wake-up call, a timeout. Something should have been done and nothing was done, so it continued. You don't play like that. You don't let a hot player just keep on going. We didn't do that." Martin, who was suspended the last two games, was on his best behavior. He didn't argue a questionable foul call early, and he helped Brand up after the two collided and fell on Martin's drive to the basket. Martin also had a monster dunk in the fourth quarter. Game notes
The win was New Jersey's 23rd. The Nets didn't reach that number until March 20 of last season. ... The Nets are 12-4 at home. ... The Nets only have the advantage over two teams in their overall history -- the Clippers and the Grizzlies. ... This is the latest in a season that the Clippers and Nets have played with both teams over the .500 mark. ... The Nets are starting to draw celebrities. Actor Billy Crystal sat next to actress Penny Marshall, who has been here before. ... Jefferson had the block of the game on a fast break by Brand. ... Clippers guard Corey Maggette left the game in the third quarter with a strained knee.
